official-title.#text:
To amend titles II and XVIII of the Social Security Act
		  to establish a Social Security Surplus Protection Account in the Federal
		  Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund to hold the Social Security surplus
		  and a Medicare Surplus Protection Account in the Federal Hospital Insurance
		  Trust Fund to hold the Medicare surplus, to provide for suspension of
		  investment of amounts held in such Accounts until enactment of legislation
		  providing for investment of the Trust Funds in investment vehicles other than
		  obligations of the United States, and to establish a Social Security and
		  Medicare Part A Investment Commission to make recommendations for alternative
		  forms of investment of the Social Security and Medicare
		  surpluses.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Social Security and Medicare
			 Lock-Box Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited
			 as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds the following:

header.#text:
Findings
			 regarding social security and Medicare part A

text.#text:
Long term projections
			 show serious problems facing the fiscal health of the trust funds associated
			 with Social Security and Medicare Hospital Insurance.

According to the 2012 Annual Report of
			 the Board of Trustees of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance and
			 Federal Disability Insurance Trust Funds, the assets of the combined Federal
			 Old Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance
			 Trust Fund will be exhausted by 2033, and the Disability Insurance Trust Fund
			 alone will be depleted by 2016.

According to the 2012 Annual Report of
			 the Board of Trustees of the Federal Hospital Insurance and Federal
			 Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Funds, the assets of the Federal Hospital
			 Insurance Trust Fund will be exhausted by 2024.

The Trustees of these
			 trust funds strongly encourage action to protect the solvency of the trust
			 funds.

quote.#text:
Lawmakers should not delay addressing the long-run
			 financial challenges facing Social Security and Medicare. If they take action
			 sooner rather than later, more options and more time will be available to phase
			 in changes so that the public has adequate time to prepare.

text.#text:
In their message to the public,
			 included in the 2012 Annual Reports, the Social Security and Medicare Boards of
			 Trustees wrote,

Social Security
			 and Medicare are meant to provide a secure and stable base so that older
			 Americans can live in dignity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Any path to solvency must include the protection of
			 future surpluses.

text.#text:
Protecting the
			 future surpluses of these trust funds can only occur when meaningful reform has
			 been enacted by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 201(d) of the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Interim
			 protections for Social Security trust fund surplus

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , it shall be the duty

quote.#text: (1) on original issue at the issue price, or (2)
(A) on original issue at the issue price, or (B)

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following new paragraph:

There is established in
				the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund a Social Security
				Surplus Protection Account. As soon as practicable after each fiscal year after
				fiscal year 2013, the Managing Trustee shall transfer to the Account, from
				amounts otherwise available in the Trust Fund, amounts equivalent to the social
				security surplus for such fiscal year. Such amounts shall be transferred from
				time to time to the Account, such amounts to be determined on the basis of
				estimates by the Managing Trustee, and proper adjustments shall be made in
				amounts subsequently transferred to the extent prior estimates were in excess
				of or were less than the correct amount.

header.#text:
Social Security and
			 Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this section referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Social Security and
			 Medicare Part A Investment Commission
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

text.#text:
There
			 is established in the executive branch of the Government a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a
			 study to ascertain the most effective vehicles for investment of the Federal
			 Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Hospital Insurance
			 Trust Fund, other than investment in the form of obligations of the United
			 States resulting in the transfer of Trust Fund assets to the general fund of
			 the Treasury. Not later than October 1, 2014, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit a
			 report to the President and to each House of the Congress setting forth its
			 recommendations for such vehicles for investment, together with proposals for
			 such administrative and legislative changes as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines
			 necessary to authorize and implement such recommendations.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

text.#text:
As soon as practicable
			 after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be composed of—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , of whom 1 shall be designated by the
as Chairman;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: minority leader of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: minority leader of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

shall have substantial
			 experience, training, and expertise in the management of financial investments
			 and pension benefit plans.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall serve for the life
			 of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . A vacancy on the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be filled in the manner in
			 which the original appointment was made and shall be subject to any conditions
			 that applied with respect to the original appointment.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall meet—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

text.#text:
not less than once
			 during each month; and

at additional
			 times at the call of the Chairman.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall perform the functions and exercise
			 the powers of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on a majority vote of a quorum of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
.
			 Three members of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall constitute a quorum for the transaction
			 of business.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not impair the authority of a quorum of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to perform the functions and exercise the powers of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission
Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
who is not an officer or
			 employee of the Federal Government shall be compensated at the daily rate of
			 basic pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule for each day during which such
			 member is engaged in performing a function of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission
Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be paid travel, per diem, and other necessary
			 expenses under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, while
			 traveling away from such member’s home or regular place of business in the
			 performance of the duties of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall terminate 90 days after the date of the submission of its
			 report pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Part A Investment Commission
